locutie.beschrijving: The preacher contrasts the 'wise and intelligent' (winners/kings) with 'babies' (disciples/innocents). He uses the anecdotes of Abd al-Rahman III and Martin Niemoeller to illustrate the difference between worldly success and the joy of discipleship.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong focus on the socio-political implications of the text (Empire vs. Kingdom), though it leans more toward narrative illustration than technical exegesis.

illocutie.beschrijving: The primary force is ASSERTING the reality of the Kingdom, but it shifts toward the end into INVITING and BLESSING.
voorbeelden: I thank you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth.
Blessed are your eyes that have seen what you see.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To make the hearer feel the exhaustion of 'performance' and find rest in the 'easy yoke' of Christ.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit; the Spirit is not explicitly named, but the 'transformative power' is referenced.

voorbeelden: Jesus lines out the stark contrast.
It will not and cannot be better than that.
commissieven.kwaliteit: The promises are largely quoted from Jesus rather than directly uttered by the preacher as a mandate.

voorbeelden: That, dear sweet baby, is what we know.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher uses the 'Blessed' formula to enact a change in the hearer's status at the conclusion.

indicatoren: Extensive storytelling about the Caliph and Niemoeller.
Describing the history of church dogma (homoousia, etc.).
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is an observer of a brilliant lecture/narrative for the first 15 minutes.

missende_elementen: Immediate sacramental address ('I promise you today')
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Delayed encounter; the 'event' only happens in the final third.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High quality but mostly mediated through the biblical text.
voorbeelden: Rest and joy for endless, uncounted days!

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address as 'babies' and 'infants'â€”very effective and intimate.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Talking about the Caliph, Martin, the wise, the intelligent.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a 'gallery of characters' to look at rather than a God to face.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Describing the 'way of the world' and theological truths.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the 'exhaustion' of the world (Assertive) to the 'rest' of Christ (Commissive/Declarative).
voorbeelden: The world is a brickyard (Assertive) -> Come to me (Directive) -> I will give you rest (Commissive).
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Excellent movement from indicative to imperative.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because we know... rethink and redecide.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: Despite a high word count 'talking about' things, the sermon successfully pivots into a creative act of naming the congregation 'babies' and declaring them 'blessed'.

sterke_punten.effect: Redefines the hearer's identity outside of worldly performance.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The first 300 words regarding the Caliph.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon becomes an event when it stops describing the 'wise' and starts addressing the 'babies'.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The 'toezegging' (promise) of rest is the engine of the sermon.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, through the 'altar call' of Jesus.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, the preacher takes the authority to call the congregation 'babies'.
tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus issues an altar call... I will give you rest.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The preacher invites the 'redeciding' but leaves the 'rest' as a gift.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon aims to provide the 'rest' it speaks of.
tekstueel_bewijs: The world is more like a Sabbath than it is like a brickyard.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Heavy use of past-tense narrative verbs; needs more present-tense performative verbs in the body.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Jesus lines out the stark contrast.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: I place before you today the stark contrast.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from reporting Jesus' action to performing the action in the pulpit.

voorbeeldzinnen: I promise you, in Christ, your 14 days are now an eternity.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much time spent on 'The Caliph' and 'The Wise'.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Interweave the address to the 'babies' earlier.
voorbeeldzinnen: You, baby, are not like that Caliph.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of narrative preaching that successfully 'lands' in a performative blessing.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT focuses on the fact that the preacher's words *do* something (bless), not just how the 'receiver' feels.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The power is not in the 'snappy starter' but in the 'Commissives' (I will give you rest).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's climax is a Declarative act ('Blessed are your eyes'), which creates the reality it names.

declaratief: is (in the sense of 'this is what you are')

appendices.notities: The use of 'Baby' as a vocative is a brilliant performative move that breaks the 'wise/intelligent' frame.
